metadata.title: CVE-2022-0185 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - high
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the way thelegacy_parse_param function in the Filesystem Context functionality of theLinux kernel verified the supplied parameters length. An unprivileged (incase of unprivileged user namespaces enabled, otherwise needs namespacedCAP_SYS_ADMIN privilege) local user able to open a filesystem that does notsupport the Filesystem Context API (and thus fallbacks to legacy handling)could use this flaw to escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
